Description: Rim sherd of South Ionian pottery cup with everted rim; interior: reserved band at top of lip, glazed black below; exterior: narrow black band at top of lip, faint dilute lines on lip; inscription on exterior.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Apollo (Naukratis), Stratum 45 [according to BM register]
Type series: Vallet and Villard Ionian Cup Type A2 (possibly)
Curator's comments: Although Schlotzhauer (Schlotzhauer 2012) does not discuss this sherd, the high rim and decoration find parallels with his South Ionian cups with everted rim Type 5C. These cups are both the earliest South Ionian cups at Naukratis and are relatively rare at the site. These cups coincide with Petrie’s class L1 (Petrie 1886, 18), Hayes’ Ionian Cup Type IX (Boardman and Hayes 1966, 111-116), and Vallet and Villard Ionian Cup Type A2 (Vallet and Villard, 1964, 87-88).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.078) (Phase 3)
